images.text_verbatim:
FRAMING NOTES:
1. ALL DIMENSIONS, INCLUDING ROUGH OPENING SIZES, SHALL BE CONFIRMED BEFORE CONSTRUCTION. DIMENSION DISCREPENCIES SHALL BE REPORTED IMMEDIATELY.
2. STUD WALLS SHALL BE ANCHORED TO FOUNDATION WITH 1/2" ANCHOR BOLTS @ 48" SPACINGS AND WITHIN 6" OF ENDS OR CORNERS.
3. WIND-BRACING SHALL BE PROVIDED @ 45 DEGREE ANGLE ON ALL EXTERIOR WALL CORNERS AS PER ELEVATION DETAILS.
4. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL ENSURE ANY TEMPORARY BRACINGS OF WALLS OR TRUSSES ARE ADEQUATE.
5. ALL TRUSS BRACING SHALL BE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE APPROVED ENGINEERED DRAWINGS OF THE TRUSS MANUFACTURER. DIAGONAL BRACING MUST BE PROVIDED ON ALL MEMBERS THAT REQUIRE LATERAL BRACING.
6. TRUSS SHOP DRAWINGS SHALL BE CERTIFIED BY A PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER WHERE REQUIRED AND REVIEWED BY THE CONTRACTOR FOR DIMENSIONAL CORRELATION WITH THE DRAWINGS AND FIELD CONDITIONS.
7. ALL WOOD SHALL BE No. 2 SPF OR BETTER.
8. STUDS SHALL BE SECURED TO PLATES W/ (3) 3½" NAILS.
9. PRECAUTIONS SHALL BE TAKEN TO NOT OVERLOAD THE STRUCTURE DURING CONSTRUCTION.
10. ALL FASTENER INTO P.T. LUMBER TO BE STAINLESS OR HOT-DIPPED GALVANIZED

STEEL:
1. ALL DIMENSIONS ARE IN INCHES UNLESS NOTED OTHERWISE (U.N.O.).
2. ALL STEEL SHALL BE DESIGNED, FABRICATED AND ERECTED IN CONFORMANCE TO CAN/CSA-S16-09 AND THE 2012 ONTARIO BUILDING CODE.
3. ALL STEEL MEMBERS TO BE NEW MEMBERS.
4. ALL ROLLED STRUCTURAL STEEL MEMBERS SHALL CONFORM TO CSA-G40.20-04/G40.21-04-M300W EXCEPT WIDE FLANGE SECTIONS (W), WHICH SHALL CONFORM TO CSA-G40.20-04/G40.21-04-M350W.
5. WELDING SHALL CONFORM TO CSA-W59-03 LATEST EDITION. ELECTRODES SHALL BE E70XX OR BETTER.
6. ALL WELDS SHALL BE FILLET ALL AROUND, WITH SIZE EQUAL TO THE LESSER OF 1/4" OR THE MINIMUM THICKNESS OF ADJOINING FACES, U.N.O.
7. ALL HOLE SIZES ARE 13/16" DIAMETER, U.N.O.
8. CONNECTION BOLTS SHALL BE ASTM A325 HIGH STRENGTH BOLTS, U.N.O.
9. ALL BOLTED CONNECTIONS SHALL BE BEARING TYPE, U.N.O.
10. ALL CONNECTIONS SHALL BE INSPECTED AS PER CAN/CSA-S16-09.
11. FIELD VERIFY ALL DIMENSIONS PRIOR TO MANUFACTURING.
12. ALL STRUCTURAL STEEL TO BE FINISHED AS APPROVED BY THE GENERAL CONTRACTOR.

EGRESS FARM NOTES:
1. MAXIMUM TRAVEL DISTANCE T AN EXIT SHALL NOT EXCEED 45m (147 ft)
2. WINDOW USED AS EXITS REQUIRE A MINIMUM OPENING OF 22" X 36"
3. EXITS MUST BE ACCESSIBLE AT ALL TIMES AND BE CLEARLY VISIBLE

FIRE SEPARATION (NFBC 3.1.1.2. - 1 STOREY BLDG.):
1. PROPOSED ONE STORY BUILDING: MAIN FLOOR = 5000 sq. ft.
TOTAL = 5000 sq. ft.
(NO FIRE SEPARATIONS REQUIRED)
VERIFY THAT THE STRUCTURE IS NOT WITHIN 96'-5" OF A PROPERTY LINE, PUBLIC THOROUGHFARE OR A DWELLING LOCATED ON THE PROPERTY. CONTACT THE PROJECT ENGINEER IF THESE REQUIREMENTS CANNOT BE MET.

DESIGN LOADS:
1. DESIGN LOADS UNFACTORED U.N.O. AND DO NOT INCLUDE IMPORTANCE FACTOR
A. CLIMATIC DESIGN DATA (MOUNT FOREST)
Ss = 2.7 kPa
Sr = 0.4 kPa
q(1/10) = 0.32 kPa
B. ROOF (DEAD) = 0.4 kPa (NO CEILING)
4/12 PITCH (SLIPPERY ROOF / NON-SOLAR)
SNOW LOAD = 1.67 kPa BALANCED
1.89 kPa UNBALANCED
2. THIS BUILDING IS DESIGNED FOR "LOW HUMAN OCCUPANCY"

FIRE SEPARATION (N.F.B.C. 3.1.1.2 - 1 STOREY BLDG.):
1. PROPOSED ONE STORY BUILDING 5000 sq. ft.
TOTAL 5000 sq. ft.
(NO FIRE SEPARATIONS REQUIRED)
VERIFY THAT THE STRUCTURE IS NOT WITHIN 96'-5" OF A PROPERTY LINE, PUBLIC THOROUGHFARE OR A DWELLING LOCATED ON THE PROPERTY. CONTACT THE PROJECT ENGINEER IF THESE REQUIREMENTS CANNOT BE MET.

FOUNDATION PLAN
MAIN FLOOR PLAN
ROOF PLAN

FRONT & LEFT ELEVATIONS
REAR & RIGHT ELEVATIONS
DETAILS

images.summary: This image contains general notes related to framing, steel, egress, fire separation, and design loads for a construction project. The framing notes specify requirements for dimensions, anchoring, wind-bracing, and truss bracing. Steel notes outline standards for dimensions, fabrication, welding, and connections, referencing CAN/CSA standards. Egress notes detail maximum travel distances and window exit requirements. Fire separation notes indicate that no separations are required for a proposed 5000 sq. ft. building, with specific distance requirements from property lines. Design loads include climatic data and roof load specifications. The drawing name section lists various plans and sections included in the project documentation.

images.summary: This schedule provides details for piers, footings, and base plates. The pier schedule specifies a 20-inch diameter pier made of 25 MPa concrete, with reinforcement as per detail 1/S9. The footing schedule describes a post and pier footing measuring 4'-0" x 4'-0" x 12" thick, constructed with 20 MPa concrete and reinforced with four 15M rebar each way, to be placed on undisturbed soil, as detailed in 1/S9. The base plate schedule lists two types: BP1, a 12" x 12" x 3/4" base plate, and BP2, a 6" x 12" x 3/4" base plate, with references to details 1/S9 and 2/S9 respectively.

images.summary: This foundation plan outlines the layout and specifications for the building's foundation. The plan includes dimensions of 100'-0" by 50'-0" and features unexcavated areas with a 6-inch concrete floor made of 32 MPa concrete, supported by a minimum of 6 inches of compacted granular 'A' fill over undisturbed soil. Wall reinforcement at columns is specified with four 15M vertical rebar and 10M ties at 10 inches on center, with a double top tie. The foundation walls include an 8-inch wall at 7'-4" high and an 8-inch retaining wall at 11'-4" high, both reinforced as per details 3/S8 and 2/S8 respectively. The pier schedule specifies a 20-inch diameter pier, and the footing schedule details a post and pier footing with dimensions 4'-0" x 4'-0" x 12" thick. Base plates BP1 and BP2 are also detailed, with references to details 1/S9 and 2/S9.

Section callouts 1/S5 and 1/S3 are present, referencing additional details or sections. The plan is drawn at a scale of 1/8" = 1'-0".

images.summary: This plan view illustrates the layout of storage areas on the ground floor, including hay bale, corn, and soybean storage. The dimensions are clearly marked, such as 100'-0" for the overall length and 50'-0" for the width. The framed wall schedule details the construction of various walls: W10 (2x6 exterior end wall with metal cladding), W11 (2x6 interior partition with plywood liner), and W12 (2x6 exterior side wall with metal cladding). The lintel schedule specifies steel beams L1 (W12X26) and L2 (W10X22), with details referenced in 3/S6 and 1-3/S9. L3 is a 2x10 lintel nailed to the bottom truss chord. Columns C1 and C2 are HSS steel columns, with C1 being 5" x 5" x 1/4" and C2 being 6" x 6" x 3/8". The plan emphasizes the need for contractors to verify all dimensions before construction.

images.summary: This schedule provides detailed specifications for framed walls and lintels. The wall schedule includes W10 (2x6 exterior end wall with metal cladding), W11 (2x6 interior partition with plywood liner), and W12 (2x6 exterior side wall with metal cladding). Each wall type specifies the stud size, spacing, and additional requirements like blocking and bracing. The lintel schedule lists L1 as a W12X26 steel beam and L2 as a W10X22 steel beam, both with details in 3/S6 and 1-3/S9. L3 is a 2x10 lintel nailed to the bottom truss chord, with full-length studs on each side. Contractors are reminded to verify all dimensions before construction.

images.summary: This roof plan illustrates the layout of pre-engineered farm trusses spaced at 48 inches on center. The trusses are set directly above the studs, as indicated by the note 'SET DIRECTLY ABOVE STUD, TYP.' A continuous 2x6 'X' brace is fastened to the top of the bottom chord, providing additional stability. The top plate of the wall is fastened to the bottom chord of the truss with 3" 7d toe nails spaced at 16 inches on center. The plan includes a section callout '1/S5', indicating a related section view. The scale of the drawing is 1/8" = 1'-0".

images.summary: This roof plan shows the arrangement of pre-engineered farm trusses spaced at 48 inches on center, with each truss set directly above the studs. A continuous 2x6 'X' brace is attached to the top of the bottom chord for reinforcement. The top plate of the wall is secured to the bottom chord of the truss using 3" 7d toe nails at 16 inches on center. The plan includes a section callout '1/S5', linking to a related section view. Contractors are advised to verify all dimensions before construction and report any discrepancies immediately.

TRUSS TOP CHORD

images.summary: This detail view focuses on the lateral 'X' bracing system for roof trusses. The bracing consists of 2x4 struts, each 5'-0" long, attached at the top and bottom with two 3 1/2" nails at each truss web member. Diagonal braces are anchored to the lateral with four 3 1/2" nails at the intersection of the truss web and truss lateral. The spacing of the 2x4 diagonal bracing is determined by the bracing designer. The detail emphasizes the importance of tight butt joints at all splice locations and the need for the diagonal brace to extend fully from the top chord to the bottom chord of the truss. The section callout '2/S5' refers to this specific detail.

images.summary: This section view illustrates a building section focusing on the roof and wall assembly. The roof features a 4/12 pitch with 29 ga metal roof cladding and 2x4 strapping at 24 inches on center. Pre-engineered farm trusses are spaced at 48 inches on center. The section includes details such as truss uplift clips per manufacturer drawings, continuous double top plate, and a typical sill assembly with 1/2 inch anchor bolts at 48 inches on center. The wall assembly includes a vented soffit, 2x6 top and bottom strapping with 3½ inch nails, and a stud wall per plan. The foundation consists of footing and foundation wall per plan, with backfill using parent material. The section also specifies lateral 'X' bracing of truss laterals as per manufacturer drawings, referencing detail 2/S5. Ridge venting is provided per OBC, and the section notes that the truss may not be as shown. The floor is constructed per plan with a thickened edge slab.

images.summary: This section view shows a building section with emphasis on the roof and wall assembly. The roof has a 4/12 pitch with 29 ga metal roof cladding and 2x4 strapping at 24 inches on center. Pre-engineered farm trusses are spaced at 48 inches on center. The section includes truss uplift clips as per manufacturer drawings, a continuous double top plate, and a typical sill assembly with 1/2 inch anchor bolts at 48 inches on center. The wall assembly features a vented soffit, 2x6 top and bottom strapping with 3½ inch nails, and a stud wall per plan. The foundation includes footing and foundation wall as per plan, with backfill using parent material. The section specifies lateral 'X' bracing of truss laterals as per manufacturer drawings, referencing detail 2/S5. Ridge venting is provided per OBC, and the truss may not be as shown. The floor is constructed per plan with a thickened edge slab. The total height of the column, beam, and plates is 16 feet, with the top of the beam including plates at 1 foot.

images.text_verbatim:
NOTES FOR BRACING OF ROOF TRUSS(ES) :
1 -- >> CONTRACTOR AND OR OWNER TO NOTIFY MANUFACTURER OF ANY
TRUSS DEFICIENCIES SUCH AS DAMAGED OR BROKEN TRUSSES, WARPING OF TRUSS
MEMBERS, AND MISSING OR OFFSET TRUSS PLATES.
2 -- >> DIAGONAL BRACING MUST BE PROVIDED ON ALL WEB MEMBERS THAT REQUIRE LATERAL
BRACING. DIAGONAL BRACING SHALL BE SPACED AS NOTED ON THE ATTACHED DRAWING(S),
& X-BRACING SHALL BE PROVIDED @ ENDWALLS @ INTERVALS NOTED ON THE ROOF PLAN.
3 -- >> PERMANENT LATERAL BRACING TO BE INSTALLED ON WEB MEMBERS AS
INDICATED ON THE ROOF PLAN AND MANUFACTURERS DRAWINGS.
4 -->> PROVIDE DIAGONAL BRACING @ ALL DISCONTINUITIES IN LATERAL
BRACING SUCH AS WHERE TRUSS TYPE CHANGES
5 -->> THE TRUSS SUPPLIER SHALL DESIGN THE TRUSSES FOR THE BRACING
NOTED. BRACING DETAILS WILL NOT BE MODIFIED UNLESS SPECIFIED
BY THE BUILDING DESIGNER.
images.summary: This note section provides detailed instructions for the bracing of roof trusses. It emphasizes the responsibility of the contractor or owner to notify the manufacturer of any truss deficiencies, such as damaged or broken trusses, warping, and missing or offset truss plates. Diagonal bracing is required on all web members needing lateral bracing, with specific spacing noted on attached drawings. X-bracing is to be provided at endwalls at intervals noted on the roof plan. Permanent lateral bracing must be installed on web members as indicated on the roof plan and manufacturer drawings. Diagonal bracing should be provided at all discontinuities in lateral bracing, such as where truss type changes. The truss supplier is responsible for designing the trusses for the specified bracing, and bracing details will not be modified unless specified by the building designer.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the beam and column connection, focusing on the use of steel beams and columns. It includes a 3/8 inch web stiffener on each side of the web directly above the column for thru beams. Double top plates are bolted to the steel beam with 1/2 inch diameter bolts at 24 inches on center, staggered. A 1/2 inch by beam width by 12 inch top plate is secured with four 3/4 inch A325 bolts through the plate into the beam flange. Steel posts are used as per plan. The detail specifies the use of 3/4 inch A325 bolts to connect beams, with a chart indicating the number of bolts required for different beam sizes (e.g., W24 beam requires 6 bolts). The top plate measures 8 inches by 6½ inches by ¾ inch. The detail is referenced as 3/S6 and is drawn to a scale of 1/2 inch equals 1 foot.

images.summary: This foundation wall detail, labeled as W4, shows a stud wall with a retaining wall made of 25 MPa concrete. images.text_verbatim:
2x6 DIAGONAL BRACE
TRIPLE SOLID BLOCKING BETWEEN STUDS FASTEN W/ (6) 3 1/2" NAILS THROUGH FACE & (3) NAILS THROUGH STUD INTO EACH END OF EACH BLOCK
(3) 1/2" X 6" WEDGE ANCHOR TYP. AT EACH BRACE LOCATION USE 1 1/2" BIT TO CUT HOLES IN BLOCKING TO ALLOW PLACING OVER BOLT HEADS.
BOTTOM CONNECTION
(2) 3 1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS EACH STUD (TYP.)
(12) 3 1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS EACH BRACE (TOTAL 36 NAILS)
DBL SOLID BLOCKING BETWEEN STUDS FASTEN W/ (6) 3 1/2" NAILS THROUGH FACE & (3) NAILS THROUGH STUD INTO EACH END OF EACH BLOCK
TOP CONNECTION
images.summary: This detail shows a wall bracing system with a 2x6 diagonal brace. The brace is supported by triple solid blocking between studs, fastened with six 3 1/2-inch nails through the face and three nails through the stud into each end of each block. At the bottom connection, three 1/2-inch by 6-inch wedge anchors are used at each brace location, with instructions to use a 1 1/2-inch bit to cut holes in the blocking to allow placing over bolt heads. Each stud is fastened with two 3 1/2-inch common spiral nails, and each brace uses twelve 3 1/2-inch common spiral nails, totaling 36 nails. The top connection uses double solid blocking with similar fastening instructions.

images.location: Wall bracing connection detail with notes
images.text_verbatim:
NOTES:
1. 2x6 BRACE IS TO BE CONTINUOUS AND END AT STUD CONNECTION TO PLATE.
2. DO NOT NOTCH BRACES INTO STUDS.
3. INSTALL BRACES AT APPROXIMATELY 45 DEG. ANGLES, 2 EACH END OF WALLS.
4. MIN. NAIL SPACING 1-1/4".
2x6 DIAGONAL BRACE
TRIPLE SOLID BLOCKING BETWEEN STUDS FASTEN W/ (6) 3 1/2" NAILS THROUGH FACE & (3) NAILS THROUGH STUD INTO EACH END OF EACH BLOCK
(2) 1/2" X 6" WEDGE ANCHOR TYP. AT EACH BRACE LOCATION USE 1 1/2" BIT TO CUT HOLES IN BLOCKING TO ALLOW PLACING OVER BOLT HEADS.
BOTTOM CONNECTION
(2) 3 1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS EACH STUD (TYP.)
(12) 3 1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS EACH BRACE (TOTAL 24 NAILS)
images.summary: This detail includes a wall bracing system with a 2x6 diagonal brace and accompanying notes. The brace is continuous and ends at the stud connection to the plate. It should not be notched into studs and is installed at approximately 45-degree angles, two at each end of walls. Minimum nail spacing is 1-1/4 inches. The brace is supported by triple solid blocking between studs, fastened with six 3 1/2-inch nails through the face and three nails through the stud into each end of each block. At the bottom connection, two 1/2-inch by 6-inch wedge anchors are used at each brace location. Each stud is fastened with two 3 1/2-inch common spiral nails, and each brace uses twelve 3 1/2-inch common spiral nails, totaling 24 nails.

images.text_verbatim:

2x6 DIAGONAL BRACE
(12) 3 1/2" COMMON SPIRAL NAILS EACH BRACE (TOTAL 24 NAILS)
TOP CONNECTION
images.summary: This detail illustrates the top connection of a wall bracing system using a 2x6 diagonal brace. The brace is supported by double solid blocking between studs, fastened with six 3 1/2-inch nails through the face and three nails through the stud into each end of each block. Each brace uses twelve 3 1/2-inch common spiral nails, totaling 24 nails. This configuration ensures a secure top connection for the wall bracing system.

Two top plates are fastened to the steel beam with 1/2-inch diameter bolts at 24 inches on center, staggered. The connection includes two M20 bolts, ASTM A325, with a 3/4-inch diameter. A shear tab is also part of the connection, and the base plate is per plan. The moment connection is indicated on one side, while the standard connection is on the other.

images.summary: This combined detail shows both a pier and base plate assembly. The pier detail (BP1) includes a 12" x 12" x 3/4" base plate bolted to a 20" diameter concrete pier with (4) 3/4" x 16" anchor bolts. The pier is reinforced with (4) 15M vertical bars and 10M ties at 10 inches on center, with a double top tie. The base plate detail (BP2) is 8" x 12" x 3/4" with similar reinforcement.
